text: Poecilarcys is a genus of African orb-weaver spiders containing the single species, Poecilarcys ditissimus. It was first described by Eugène Simon in 1895 to hold the single species moved from the now obsolete "catch-all" genus Epeira. It has only been found in Tunisia. ==References== Category:Araneidae Category:Monotypic Araneomorphae genera Category:Spiders of Africa Category:Taxa named by Eugène Simon
title: Poecilarcys
